diseases.name: Acne
diseases.description: Acne is a common skin condition where the pores of your skin clog. Pore blockages produce blackheads, whiteheads, and other types of pimples. The medical term for acne is acne vulgaris.
symptoms: Blackheads: Plugged pores with a black top.
Whiteheads: Plugged pores with a white top.
Nodules: Large lumps under your skin that are painful.
Cysts: Painful fluid-filled lumps under your skin.
treatment: Treatment to heal blemishes and stop new pimples from forming.

diseases.name: Drug Eruption
diseases.description: A drug eruption is a skin reaction to medication, commonly presenting as a red, itchy rash.
symptoms: Involvement of skin folds or generalized rash.
treatment: Topical or oral corticosteroids for inflammation.

diseases.name: Eczema
diseases.description: Eczema causes dry, itchy, inflamed skin due to a weakened skin barrier.

diseases.name: Lichen
diseases.description: Lichen planus is a rash that can develop on the skin, inside the mouth, or on nails.
treatment: Retinoids and immunosuppressants for severe cases.

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune skin condition that causes scaling and inflammation.
symptoms: Red patches covered with silvery scales.
treatment: Topical corticosteroids and vitamin D analogues.

diseases.name: Skin Cancer
diseases.description: Skin cancer involves abnormal growth of skin cells, often due to UV radiation. Types include basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and melanoma.

diseases.name: Tinea
diseases.description: Tinea, or ringworm, is a fungal infection that affects skin, hair, and nails.

diseases.name: Vitiligo
diseases.description: Vitiligo causes skin color loss in patches due to the loss of melanocytes.
treatment: Cosmetic solutions for covering affected areas.

diseases.name: Warts
diseases.description: Warts are skin growths caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV), commonly on hands, feet, and other parts of the body.
treatment: Electrosurgery or laser therapy for resistant warts.

diseases.name: Unknown_Normal
diseases.description: Normal skin with no observable disease or abnormalities.
